title: Mandatory Declassification Review: footage of the July 31, 2022 drone strike in Kabul

communications.communication:
This is a request for a mandatory declassification review (MDR), under the terms of section 3.5 of E.O. 13526, seeking the following documents:

Audio-visual recordings ("recordings") of the sensors from the unmanned aerial vehicles (henceforth "UAV's") for the targeted operation credited with the killing of Ayman al-Zawahiri, on July 31, 2022 in  Kabul, Afghanistan ("the operation"), as well as recordings of communications among participants in the operation. 

Please note:
• Video recordings may be in multiple varieties, such as different light spectra (e.g., visible light spectrum recordings from an electro-optical sensor vs. recordings of video shot from an infrared camera). All of these are of interest and should be provided in separate video files where possible.
• While recordings from the sensors of the MQ-9 Reaper drone publicly credited with the launch of missiles is of interest, I also request any footage from any separate UAV's in the operation (e.g., an Intelligence Surveillance & Reconnaissance UAV used to observe the area immediately before and after the strike).
• Any audio-video recordings from communications related to the recordings (for instance, audio of pilots and sensor operators coordinating) should also be released.

I am requesting this review and release because I believe it contains information that is of public interest and does not pose a threat to national security if released.

Please acknowledge receipt of this request and provide an estimated timetable for the review. If you have any questions or need additional information, please contact me at this email address.

Sincerely,
T. McElwee

communications.subject: Welcome to the Public Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear amy martin, 
Thank you for registering with the City of Kirkland Public Records Center. If you submitted the request yourself, congratulations you are done! If the City submitted the request on your behalf, please follow the steps below to log in to your account for the first time:  
  * Click the link to the Public Records Portal (http://www.kirklandwa.gov/depart/Finance_and_Administration/Public_Records/Public_Records_Request/PRRPortal.htm) 
  * Select "View My Public Records Request." 
  * Select "Edit Customer Account Information." 
  * Underneath the submit button, click, "if you don't know or have forgotten your password, click here." 
  * Type in your email address, and click send. 
  * Once you receive the temporary password and log in for the first time, the portal will ask that you change your temporary password. 
Now you can successfully monitor the progress of your request. Should you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact the City Clerk's Office at (425) 587-3190. 
 
City of Kirkland

title: UFOs and Unusual Phenomena in NYS

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: UFOs and Unusual Phenomena in NYS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any reports, files, or other documentation related to sightings of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) within any parks, recreational areas, or other properties in NY State for the period of January 1, 2010 to present.

Any reports, files, or other documentation related to unusual phenomena or events that occurred within any parks, recreational areas, or other properties in NY State for the period of January 1, 2010 to present.

Please include all correspondence, memos, letters, emails, notes, audio recordings, photographs, and any other documentation related to these reports.

If any part of my request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) upon which you rely. In addition, please provide me with the name, title, and email address of the individual responsible for the denial of any part of my request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Law Request :: W113528-031623
communications.communication:
Office of General Counsel 
P: (518) 402-9522 | F: 
www.dec.ny.gov 

Date: 03/16/2023 

Dear Jackson Parker, 

I write regarding your Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request seeking: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records: 

Any reports, files, or other documentation related to sightings of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) within any parks, recreational areas, or other properties in NY State for the period of January 1, 2010 to present. 

Any reports, files, or other documentation related to unusual phenomena or events that occurred within any parks, recreational areas, or other properties in NY State for the period of January 1, 2010 to present. 

Please include all correspondence, memos, letters, emails, notes, audio recordings, photographs, and any other documentation related to these reports. 

If any part of my request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) upon which you rely. In addition, please provide me with the name, title, and email address of the individual responsible for the denial of any part of my request. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 
In order for DEC to accurately search for the records you seek, we need you to give us more specific information describing the records. Please provide as much of the following information as you can. lease clarify what you mean by “unusual phenomena or events”, because it is too vague. Staff won’t be about to search for records with that. If we do not receive your reply within one week of the date of this message, your request will be denied, because without the specific information or clarification this message seeks from you, the records are not "reasonably described" within the meaning of Public Officers Law §89(3)(a), and we will close out the request in our system. 

If you have any questions, please call me at (518) 402-9522 and refer to FOIL request #W113528-031623, or simply reply to this email.  Thank you. 

Sincerely, 
Records Access

title: Energy Ant

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Energy Ant
communications.communication:
Dear U.S. Department of Energy:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED:

I am seeking records related to DOE's mascot, Energy Ant. Specifically, I request the following records:

1. Please produce all records related to the conception, creation, and design of the Energy Ant mascot. Please include any contracts or design concepts (e.g. sketches) in your production, as well as all records related to DOE's decision to create a mascot in the first place.

2. Please produce all Energy Ant-related promotional items, educational items, or tchotchkes, past or present, that took the form of records, such as trading cards, posters, or books (including but not limited to coloring books, activity books, or comic books).

3. Please produce all records related to the conception, creation, design, and use of any life-size Energy Ant costume. Responsive records would include contracts for the design or production of such a costume; design proposals or sketches; correspondence with the designer or manufacturer; and any guidelines related to the use of or care for the costume.

4. Please produce all correspondence related to Energy Ant (or to mascots in general) sent to or from any member of Congress, their office, or their staff. Oklahoma Senator Tom Coburn may have sent some responsive correspondence around 2007. Iowa Senator Jodi Ernst may also have sent responsive records.

5. Please produce all records related to any decision by DOE to stop using Energy Ant as part of its public outreach.
REQUEST FOR FEE WAIVER:

The requested documents will be made available to the general public online for free, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am working on a non-commercial project examining the history, creation, evolution, and use of mascots across the federal government—because, like many others, I find them fascinating and weirdly delightful. Thus, I respectfully request that any fees related to this request be waived. If you do decide to charge me fees, please notify me in advance if you expect those fees to exceed $25.

FORM OF PRODUCTION:

I would prefer that this request be fulfilled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or on CD-ROM if not.

CONCLUSION:

Thank you very much for your cooperation with this request. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

Sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz

title: Rasheem Carter

communications.subject: Mississippi Public Records Act Request: Rasheem Carter
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Police reports filed to Taylorsville Police Department referring to Rasheem Carter
- Any incident reports filed to Taylorsville Police Department and Smith County Sheriff's Department referring to Rasheem Carter
- Any investigation file referring to the case of Rasheem Carter
- Any video footage the Taylorsville Police Department and Smith County Sheriff's Department has in the investigation into Rasheem Carter's death. Carter's family shared video footage of a trail camera showing Rasheem on a wooded trail near Taylorsville indicating that there is video footage. 
- Any emails to, from, and cc'ing Taylorsville Police Chief Gabe Horn that includes the keywords "Rasheem Carter" "Carter" "Rasheem" 

HuffPost reported that Smith County Sheriff's Department is overseeing the criminal investigation into Rasheem's death. Taylorsville Police Chief Gabe Horn told a local newspaper in December that Rasheem Carter filed a police report when he visited the station but declined to press any charges against whomever was threatening him. Police found Rasheem's body on November 2, 2022. https://www.natchezdemocrat.com/2022/12/07/family-seeking-answers-in-fayette-mans-death/

I'm a senior reporter for the Guardian, and the family has been outspoken about this case. The case is a matter of public interest given that the case has been unresolved at the moment, and the case is under investigation. That said, I would request a rolling release of materials if possible.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Edwin Rios

title: Water Quality Complaints in Albany, Schenectady, and Troy MSA (New York State Department of Environmental Conservation)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Water Quality Complaints in Albany, Schenectady, and Troy MSA (New York State Department of Environmental Conservation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to and copies of records related to water quality complaints and issues within the Albany, Schenectady, and Troy Metropolitan Statistical Area (MSA) for the period from January 1, 2018, to the present.

Specifically, I am seeking the following information:

1) The total number of water quality complaints received by your agency/authority/utility, broken down by year.

2) A detailed summary of each water quality complaint, including:
2a. The date of the complaint
2b. The location (address or nearest cross streets) of the complaint
2c. The nature of the complaint (e.g., odor, taste, discoloration, contamination concerns)
2d. Any actions taken by your agency/authority/utility to address the complaint
2e. The resolution or current status of the complaint

3) Any reports, memos, or other documentation related to water quality complaints, investigations, and resolutions within the specified area and timeframe.

If any of this information is available in electronic format, I kindly request that you provide it via email. If physical copies are necessary, please inform me of any copying or postage fees in advance, and I will make arrangements for payment.

If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a detailed explanation for the denial and inform me of any appeal procedures available under New York State law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

2c. The nature of the complaint (e.g., odor, taste, discoloration, contamination concerns) 
2d. Any actions taken by your agency/authority/utility to address the complaint 
2e. The resolution or current status of the complaint 

3) Any reports, memos, or other documentation related to water quality complaints, investigations, and resolutions within the specified area and timeframe.

NOTE: drinking water would be under the Department of Health If we do not receive your reply within one week of the date of this message, your request will be denied, because without the specific information or clarification this message seeks from you, the records are not "reasonably described" within the meaning of Public Officers Law §89(3)(a), and we will close out the request in our system. 

If you have any questions, please call me at (518) 402-9522 and refer to FOIL request #W113527-031523, or simply reply to this email.  Thank you. 

Sincerely, 
Records Access

title: Water Quality Complaints in Albany, Schenectady, and Troy MSA (Schenectady Water Department)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Water Quality Complaints in Albany, Schenectady, and Troy MSA (Schenectady Water Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to and copies of records related to water quality complaints and issues within the Albany, Schenectady, and Troy Metropolitan Statistical Area (MSA) for the period from January 1, 2018, to the present.

Specifically, I am seeking the following information:

1) The total number of water quality complaints received by your agency/authority/utility, broken down by year.

2) A detailed summary of each water quality complaint, including:
2a. The date of the complaint
2b. The location (address or nearest cross streets) of the complaint
2c. The nature of the complaint (e.g., odor, taste, discoloration, contamination concerns)
2d. Any actions taken by your agency/authority/utility to address the complaint
2e. The resolution or current status of the complaint

3) Any reports, memos, or other documentation related to water quality complaints, investigations, and resolutions within the specified area and timeframe.

If any of this information is available in electronic format, I kindly request that you provide it via email. If physical copies are necessary, please inform me of any copying or postage fees in advance, and I will make arrangements for payment.

If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a detailed explanation for the denial and inform me of any appeal procedures available under New York State law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

communications.communication:

requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

title: Water Complaints

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Water Complaints
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all complaints regarding water in East Palestine, Ohio from January 2023-March 2023

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Victor Ledezma

title: Executive Communications

communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: Executive Communications
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All emails, Microsoft Teams communications, or other interoffice communications from the Executive Director and Executive Secretary from January 1, 2021 to December 31, 2022 regarding employee sick leave, vacation, and compensation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Johnny D Fawne.
